p: On 12 December 2019, a new type of coronavirus was identified in Wuhan Hubei Province in China [ 17]. The full genome of the novel coronavirus was posted in GenBank and the Global Initiative on Sharing All Influenza Data by Chinese health authorities and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) of America [ 8]. It was named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) by the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses on 11 February 2020 [ 1]. The disease caused by SARS-CoV-2 was named COVID-19 by the World Health Organization (WHO). On 30 January 2020, the WHO declared the outbreak of COVID-19 to be a global health emergency and further labeled it a pandemic on 11 March 2020.
